page.title: 07THE EVENING POST
page.content: From its St Saviour's offices the Jersey Evening Post(J.E.P.) publish a daily newspaper six days a week at a price of 16p. Its circulation of 24,000 copies reaches 93% of the island's population. Every morning the newspapers reporters are sent to cover the days local events. When the stories are written they get proof read to check for mistakes. World news comes from the Press Association in London. This only makes up one page. The rest of the J.E.P. is devoted to local issues, leisure, sport, advertisements and television reviews. Page two is the most widely read because it contains details of births, marriages and deaths on the island. For 1,800 readers abroad the Jersey Weekly Post is published.
